fields.description: Entering non-latin characters in QuickSearch interprets them differently than in FindIssues query string: converts them to '???', thus finding nothing.
fields.summary: QuickSearch fails to accept UTF strings

fields.description:
We encounter this after several imports followed by restore from backup. Then we invoked another import from Bugzilla.

All issues, projects and components are successfully imported; however no users are created ('Reuse existing users' does not affect the issue). Issues are associated with users which profiles can be viewed, edited -- but none appears in 'User browser'.


What may matter:
- the database backuped was created with Win1251 encoding, but later MySQL connector was configured to work with UTF
- we deleted changeitems with BugzillaImportKeys prior to the last import.
fields.summary: Zilla users are not imported under certain conditions

fields.description:
Import from Bugzilla needs permission for jira-user to:
- create issues
- add comments
- create attachments

Import works fine if permission scheme is not changed from defaults; however it fails in a legitimate scenario when real users are given read-only access to JIRA before import is done ("come and see it even before we import data: you can browse projects, but can't change anything").
fields.summary: import from Zilla depends on [default] permission scheme

fields.description: When using the danish translation all danish characters are displayed wrongly. Switching to another character encoding doesn't help.
fields.summary: Danish characters displaying wrongly

fields.description:
My ideal 'screen' for setting up CVS Integration for each project, perhaps even each project version:

pserver string - ":pserver:euan@cvs.buildonline:/home/cvs/repository"
password - "password"
modules (commer delimited) - "bol-common, bol-shared, bol-newcode"
branch (blank if HEAD) - "branch-bol-newproject"
fields.summary: CVS Integration - setup

fields.description:
Why do we need to manually check out a module so JIRA can use 'cvs log' on the checked out source when you can simply provide the pserver string and password then let JIRA use rlog.

Saves time, confusion, support requests and most importantly - mess.
fields.summary: CVS Integration - use rlog

fields.description: Besides sending emails, we would like to get informed of some issues that need urgent response, however, to incorporate this into a JIRA-SMS service, i need to store the phone number for each user.
fields.summary: Ability to store custom data for each user

fields.description:
There are two text edit fields in the "Send Test Email" page (/secure/admin/SendTestMail!default.jspa), both of them are labeled "Send Email, You can send a test email here". 

The second one should be labeled "Send Email, Log file".

There are also two sets of "Send" and "Cancel" buttons, one should suffice.
fields.summary: wrong dialog text in SendTestMail

fields.description: Global JIRA Admin cannot delete versions or components for projects. Only a user with Project Admin permission is allowed to perform these operations. Note that the global admin is allowed to add version or components.
fields.summary: JIRA Admin cannot delete components or versions

fields.description: In between workflow steps, there can be an intermediate page where certain fields can be set.  Eg. for the "resolve" action, "Resolution", "Assignee", "Fix Versions" and "Comment" are prompted for. It would be nice if arbitrary fields could be prompted for on this page, configurable per workflow transition.
fields.summary: Allow arbitrary fields to appear on Resolution page

fields.description:
The release note link should be displayed when any unreleased/released versions exists. At present, the link is only displayed if an unreleased version exists.

Release notes can be created from either released or unreleased versions - so the check on the link is restrictive.
fields.summary: Release Note link should be displayed when released/unreleased versions exist.
Release notes should be available remotely via URL

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-3854].
  {panel}

JIRA's services take a handler.params string, which is a comma-separated list of parameters, eg:

project=JRA, issuetype=1, catchemail=www.atlassian.com

It is easy to get this wrong and leave out a comma:

project=JRA, issuetype=1 catchemail=www.atlassian.com

In this case, the issue type for issues created via email will be "1 catchemail=www.atlassian.com", which breaks many things (the status icon, the edit page, and notification emails for a start).

JIRA's code for parsing handler.params should either treat space as a delimiter, or have some error checking for cases like this.
fields.summary: Better checking of service handler parameters

fields.description:
A number of people experience problems when configuring OSUser's LDAPCredentialsProvider, to check users' passwords against LDAP. There are many ways this can go wrong, and there is very little feedback when things go wrong.

To solve this, we could have a page inside JIRA which prompts the admin to enter the relevant LDAP configuration details, emulates an LDAP authentication, and if everything works, generates a correct osuser.xml.
fields.summary: LDAP configuration page

fields.description:
When passing a (valid) resolution to ResolveIssue tag, the tag reports an error, saying that the value is incorrect. 

The problem is due to the internal typing the Tag uses to store the ids of the resolutions.

Please note that the tag actually works - i.e. resolves/closes the issue, but reports an error.

Please use the attached class to replace the existing .com.atlassian.jira.jelly.tag.issue.ResolveIssue.class to correct the problem.

ENSURE that the jelly tag class gets replaces, and NOT the ResolveIssue webwork action.
fields.summary: ResolveIssue tag reports an error when setting a resolution

fields.description:
A user reports:

> We are running enterprise version 2.6.1 and we have noticed that when
> uploading files to an issue, a strange error is returned.

(screenshot of ViewIssue.jspa a .doc attachment, and error "Invalid Form Data, no boundary encountered")

> The documents are actually uploaded fine and
> we have no problems accessing them.  A search of the logs returns
> nothing unusual.  While this is not a critical problem for us, I
> would be keen to understand why this is occurring.
> Many Thanks,
fields.summary: Error adding attachments: Invalid Form Data, no boundary encountered

Drop our own 'webwork stack cleanup filter' and use the ones that were committed to webwork 1.4

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-3848].
  {panel}

It would be great to have an additional item in the permission scheme, that would allow visibility of an issue as the "current reporter's" group. Currently, only a fixed group can be added, but it's not relative  to the actual reporter or assignee.

For example: User A and B are member of G1, User C is member of G2. If the above permission scheme is possible, then User B could view issues created by User A, but not by User C. 

This is extremely helpful if the groups represent different entities, i.e. company divisions and there should be a level of privacy between the entities or groups.

I can't see that this is currently possible, or anyone else asked for this?!

Thanks.
fields.summary: Permission Level "Current Reporter's Group"

fields.description:
Refer to issue JRA-3798 
Pls respond to the latest comment added there
ALso when we switch Databases ie If Jira was pointing to a user ,and we take a oracle dump of it and transfer that to another user and make Jira to point to that Database ,it is assuming that it needs to be installed fresh
Can you lets us know why this happends
fields.summary: Import fails -Data too large exception and DB Switch Fails

fields.description:
View an issue which has a URL in the title.

View a different issue, and pick "link issue".  Click "select issue".

Notice malformatted HTML (description begins showing in left column, and not at beginning of description; underlying HTML is malformatted w/ unclosed tags).
fields.summary: Issue Picker renders bad HTML a "recently viewed" issue has a URL in the title
Create 'issue tracking best practices guide'

fields.description:
Queries do not seem to be taking into account the Fix-For version. 

When I set a Fix-For constraint of 0.9.9 in a query, the results contain issues with Fix-Versions after 0.9.9 but also includes issues that are scheduled for fix after 0.9.9.

This affects both the Find Issues page and the Roadmap. 

Because of this issue, I am currenctly unable to use JIRA for release planning.
fields.summary: Queries with Fix-For field not working

fields.description:
(i have saved a graphic in case you are interested)

how to reproduce?

move to due date field
move one year ahead (>>)
move back
look at the days...
it seems they haven't been refreshed during the move back
fields.summary: date selector displays days of week incorrect

fields.description: The View Issue RSS view does not show time estimates becuase the View Issue class doesn't have the correct function.
fields.summary: View Issue RSS view doesn't show timeestimates

fields.description:
Several search criterias not functioning:

Created Before Date throws error
Calendar links not functioning
Ex. Entering date in this field, 24-may-2004 throws error
Calendar link does not show anything in the pop up window

Specifying Reporter throws error
(choosing Current User works)
Group links not functioning
Ex. Entering a user name in field when Specify User is selected, Janine Bradley or jbradley@gce2000.com or janine throws error.  Tried all possible scenarios of entering the user's name.  None work.  Sometimes this field is not open to entering text.
fields.summary: Search query fields not functioning

fields.description:
Page /admin/XmlBackupdefault.jspa
displays, "This will backup the contents..."

This doesn't make sense because "backup" is a noun meaning the result of backing something up.  The verb form is "back up."  

The word is used correctly, as a noun, in the two sentences after that.  The label on the check box, "Backup as zip" is okay because it is ambiguous and could be construed to be a noun.  

See JRA-3690, also.  There is a dictionary.com entry pasted there, showing the correct verb form of "login," which works the same way as "setup/set up" "backup/back up" etc.  

"Backup" is a noun, the verb form of which is "back up."  
See the following link to the Future Perfect Grammar page (UK).  http://www.future-perfect.co.uk/word14.htm
It explains the issue clearly.
fields.summary: XML Backup page:  typographical error on "backup"
Allow default issue security level at component level

fields.description:
Currently you only change a limited selection of fields when doing a bulk-change on a list of issues.  

It should be possible, for instance, to update the issue security level  when doing a bulk change.
fields.summary: Bulk edit issue security levels

fields.description:
I would like to suggest the following enhancements to the screenshot applet.

1. Functionality to crop the pasted image, so only the interesting part is left.
2. Functionality to mark an area in the image (a red circle/eclipse would do nicely.

I really miss these two things, and they can't be too hard to implement in the applet.
fields.summary: Screenshot applet: enhancements
Make writing velocity mail templates simpler

fields.description:
Sometimes there are changes in our processes that would call for a better security level name, to make it easier to find and use.

It would be great if the security levels could be renamed together with their description. 

This together with JRA-3769 would effectively enable easy sorting of the levels.
fields.summary: Add ability to rename security levels

fields.description:
Note, it does show nicely in the *Edit_View* when the the issue type is equal to the the value I specified for the custom issue type field.

However, the custom issue type field *never* shows on the details view. It also *never* shows as a column in the Issue Navigator.
fields.summary: Custom field for IssueType does not show in *Details_View*
Custom field for IssueType does not show as column in Issue Navigator

fields.description: JIRA Standalone claims 256m of memory by default. Sometimes this is too much, sometimes too little, and the only way to adjust this is to edit multiple occurrences of '-Xmx256m' in bin/catalina.(bat|sh).  Instead, it should be possible to set JAVA_OPTS once, either in the script or in the invoking shell, and have its values propagated.
fields.summary: In JIRA Standalone, max memory should be adjustable by setting JAVA_OPTS

fields.description:
It would really nice if JIRA could perform a search for similar issues when a new issue is created. By showing these to the user prior to them saving the issue, duplicates have a chance of being caught before they even enter the system.

Similar functionality is offered by Scarab and is usually a standard feature in helpdesk software, and I think it'd make a great addition to JIRA also.
fields.summary: Automatic duplicate search before saving new issues

fields.description:
The current quick search feature is next to useless for large installations (many projects/issues) as it will return way too many results to be useful.

If it instead could be used to "drill into" current result sets, one could start with a decent filter and then use quick search to narrow the results until the issue set becomes manageable. This behavior would also make the quick search more intuitive (the fact that it ignores your filter settings was not obvious except from inspecting the results).

Example in case: JIRA itself has so many issues that it can be very time consuming and difficult to check for duplicates before creating a new issue.
fields.summary: Make "quick search" search within current result/filter

fields.description: I'd like to be able to hide fields such as "priority" and "assign to" from users when they're creating new issues, but keep the fields available for developers/administrators.
fields.summary: Use permission scheme to control field availability for create new issue

fields.description:
we need the ability to do up-front assignments for the BA, Developer, and QA person assigned to an issue. obviously this would be a custom field, and we could use a text field except we need to search against it and report, etc.

the "current assignment" would stay as-is, but we'd use workflow to automatically assign to the appropriate person from the custom fields when the status changes.
fields.summary: add custom field type: user / group

fields.description:
This is a manageability issue for larger installations...  I've hit this twice: once, in my company's system, when a staff member got married and changed her name, i.e. from jdoe to jsmith.

I also hit this with my own username on this system; my username is still 'tim.dawson@notiva.com' even though I no longer work at Notiva.

If your underlying data model utilized a user ID for the foreign keys instead of copying the actual username into the field, this would be a trivial matter.
fields.summary: need ability to rename existing user

fields.description: I've added a custom field for issue type "New Feature". Everything seems fine except that it doesn't show in the navigator. Note that it actually shows in the navigator configuration window and it allows me to place custom field.
fields.summary: Customer Field for Issue Type doesn't show in Navigator
Release notes should only list issues of a certain Issue Level Security

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-3821].
{panel}
{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 17 November 2017|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#eeeeee|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

We're excited to announce that Priority schemes were just shipped with Jira Software 7.6. As some of you have already noticed, 7.6 was released yesterday, and you can download it [here|https://pl.atlassian.com/software/jira/download].

*What we've built*

As mentioned in our previous update, after research, spikes, and user interviews, we've decided that introducing Priority schemes is the best solution for our customers. This feature uses a well-known administrative mechanism, and maintains a consistent experience.

*Further improvements*

We've put a lot of effort into delivering Priority schemes as early as possible to make it for the 15th anniversary. We've decided that some further improvements will be added after the Jira 7.6 release. These will include: REST APIs to manage priority schemes, the ability to copy the priority schemes, as well as some minor UI improvements. We're planning to release them in the following Jira version (most likely 7.7).

*Jira Service Desk*

We've been working closely with the Jira Service Desk team to understand the impact of Priority schemes on customers using Service Desk projects. We wanted to make sure that these customers receive the best experience when Priority schemes are introduced.
To achieve this goal, we've identified further work, and are scoping it specifically for Jira Service Desk.
To make this feature available for Jira Core and Jira Software customers as quickly as possible, we've decided to release it without the support for Service Desk projects. What it means is that admins will not be able to associate a priority scheme with a Service Desk project in the first version.
This capability will be released independently by the Jira Service Desk team. Tracked in JSDSERVER-1374

*Resolutions per issue type*

We're re-adding the previous update on Resolutions per issue type here so that it's not lost in the stream of comments on this suggestion. 
Resolutions per issue type is really a separate feature request which we'll prioritise independently. In order to track it properly, we've created a separate suggestion purely for Resolutions per issue type here: JRASERVER-65924.
In hindsight we should have separated the two a long time ago, but we promise we will use all the comments around resolutions from this suggestion in the design of the feature, so no need to put the same comments, just make sure to vote and watch the issue! We will provide further updates in there.

You can read more details regarding Priority schemes and other capabilities that we added in Jira Software 7.6 [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftware/jira-software-7-6-x-release-notes-938027181.html].
As always, we would love to hear your feedback so feel free to reach out to me directly, or post a comment in this suggestion.

Cheers,
Jakub Lazinski
Product Manager, Jira Server
{panel}
*Original request description:*

As a JIRA Administrator I need more granular configuration for my projects:
 # I want to be able to specify different priorities for different projects instead of having a global priority list. The current global priority can be used as a default, but I would like to be able to change them per project.
 # Depending on the issue type, the resolution may be different. For example: in case of bugs, the resolution may be set to "fixed", but in case of improvements there is nothing to fix and the resolution should rather be "implemented". I need to be able to specify the default resolution separately per each issue type.

*Potential Workarounds:*
 There are some workarounds that can provide some solutions to this issue:
 * [Custom fields|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Adding+a+Custom+Field] for priorities and resolutions can be used on a per-project basis.
 * Customizing velocity templates to limit the visible priorities and resolutions per project, similar to what's [posted below|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-3821?focusedCommentId=212921&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-212921] (though this approach does not apply for JIRA Cloud customers).
fields.summary: Priorities per Project and Resolutions per Issue Type

fields.description:
Searching for "foo:", or anything ending in ':', causes JIRA's search page to die with:

An error occurred searching: java.lang.reflect.UndeclaredThrowableException

This is easily demonstrable on jira.atlassian.com
fields.summary: UndeclaredThrowableException when search string ends with a colon

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-3819].
  {panel}

In large companies, we need to have a testing environment and a production environment to prevent production probems. The JIRA testing environment is used to test parameters changes (change in schemes, change in the workflow, change in a global parameter).
After the tests have been done, we want to apply the change in the production environment. We cannot do that with JIRA since we cannot export and import only the parameters.
To do that we should be able to export and import everything except issues, projects and users/groups.
A coherence control should be performed by JIRA during the importing phase. Some choices should be proposed to the users if some incoherences were detected.
fields.summary: Ability to import/export only JIRA parameters

fields.description:
Even if the "current reporter" role is added to the "Assignable users" permission, the current reporter cannot be assigned because he does not appear in the combo box of the assign screen.
If I add a group where the current reporter is, it works. The problem seams to happen only using the "current reporter" role.
fields.summary: Current reporter does not work for Assignable users permission

fields.description: If a create a new component a want also define user who is responsible for this component. All issues to this component will be automatically send to this definded user
fields.summary: Assign a compoment to User/Developer

fields.description: When clicking "Administration", it would be nice if JIRA remembered which admin page one was at last (mail queue, permission schemes, etc), instead of always defaulting to the "projects" page.  Much like how the "Browse" page remembers the context, and displays the project you last looked at.
fields.summary: Current administration page should be remembered

fields.description:
On Issue Navigator full content view, the FileSize bean is still referenced as com.atlassian.jira.web.util.FileSize. The bean has moved to Atlassian Core and should be referenced as com.atlassian.core.util.FileSize

To fix the problem change /secure/views/navigator/navigator-full.jsp from:
<webwork:bean name="'com.atlassian.jira.web.util.FileSize'" id="sizeFormatter" />

to:
<webwork:bean name="'com.atlassian.core.util.FileSize'" id="sizeFormatter" />
fields.summary: FileSize class does not exists in JIra - moved to core

fields.description:
If I could organize components in a tree like structure ( a Parent : Child type of link ) JIRA would be an excellent tool to implement issue management for systems management as well. In software development the issues are linked to sources in CVS in systems management they must be linked to configured items like a server, printer, installed software package and so on.
The request is for organizing components in a tree.
fields.summary: Add linking feature to components

fields.description: Right now, we can move an issue from one project to another. It would be helpfull if we could move a version (and all its issues) from a project to another (in my case, we are creating a derived-project).
fields.summary: Move a version form a project to another

fields.description:
1.  Surf to login page
2.  Enter a valid Username and an invalid Password (or vice-versa)
3.  Press Enter key -- see "Welcome to <system name>" followed by "Sorry, your username and password are incorrect - please try again."  

"Welcome!  You can't come in," is what is conveyed.  Imagine the nearly unbridled elation experienced by the user as he is greeted by the "Welcome" message, which is then horribly crushed as he takes in the "Sorry..." message.  Such cruelty to toy with one's emotions!  (^_^)
fields.summary: Login.jsp:  failed login results in inappropriate "Welcome" message

fields.description:
1.  Browse any project that has a custom field in its schema
    (in our case, we added a Severity field)
2.  Click FIND ISSUES and execute any query that yields a tabular of results and displays the custom field
3.  Click on the custom field's header to effect a sort
4.  Click on another, non-custom field's header (in my example, Priority was used) to effect another sort, which becomes the primary (the list is now secondarily sorted on the custom field)
5.  Save Filter -- note the displayed text under "Save Current Filter" -- "Sorted by:  priority descending, then customfield_10000 descending" -- see that the name of the custom field is not given, but some (probably) system-interal representation of it.  Note also that "priority" ought to be capitalized as the proper name of a field.  See attached .jpg.  

We don't have two custom fields, but I suggest trying a sort on two custom fields to see the result.  

I queried the JIRA project's Summary and Description for "custom field" and Type "bug" but didn't find a duplicate of this issue.
fields.summary: Save Filter page: custom field's name is displayed incorrectly

fields.description:
When setting up a issue level security scheme with many (more than 25 or so) security levels, compiling a search request takes quite a while. The problem is likely due to the work that needs to be done to add security parameters to the search request.

If a user has a few search request portlets on their dashboard, this becomes quite a problem.

Here is a sample profiling trace from a Dashboard view:

[17832ms] - /requests/secure/Dashboard.jspa
  [3325ms] - IssueManager.execute()
    [3325ms] - IssueManager.execute()
      [3325ms] - Searching Issues
        [3291ms] - Lucene Query
          [2754ms] - Permission Query
            [53ms] - PermissionManager.getProjects()
              [5ms] - ProjectManager.getProjects()
              [7ms] - SchemeManager.hasSchemeAuthority()
                [7ms] - SchemeManager.getSchemes()
            [97ms] - List.get()
            [141ms] - IssueSecurityLevelManager.getUsersSecurityLevels()
          [522ms] - Lucene Search
        [10ms] - Retrieve From cache/db and filter
          [8ms] - IssueManager.getIssue()
            [8ms] - IssueManager.getIssue()
        [6ms] - Sorting
          [6ms] - Comparator.compare()
  [2758ms] - IssueManager.execute()
    [2758ms] - IssueManager.execute()
      [2757ms] - Searching Issues
        [2757ms] - Lucene Query
          [2244ms] - Permission Query
......
fields.summary: Poor performance with large number of issue level security levels

fields.description:
Some pages/views in JIRA do not display Chinese characetrs correctly, even when using UTF-8 encoding. These pages include:

- Excel view in Issue Navigator
- Full Content View in Issue Navigator
- User picker popup
- History popup
fields.summary: Chinese characters are not displayed correctly in various pages on Weblogic

fields.summary: Need ability to enter issue/worklog back in time

fields.description: it is showing a heading like "showing issues 101 to 100 of 100"
fields.summary: The Issue Count is shown wrong in Issue navigator window

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-3803].
  {panel}

Running an open JIRA installation or an huge in house installation with a lot of issues the maintenance of the issues cost a lot of time and it is not easy at all.

In general you have to go through all the issues and clean up all issues every couple of weeks. You or the project lead have to relate issues and close any duplicates and so on.

A logical issue checker (LIC) can improve the life of this person. The LIC can perform a lot of checks which can not be provided by the common filter functionality. The following checks are possible:

1) Issues with Status = Closed and Resolution = Duplicate
a) These issues should have a linked "duplicates" issue. => Otherwise the resolution "Duplicate" doesn't make sense.
b) The Fix Version field should be empty. => Otherwise a lot of same issues would be appear in a release note which makes no sense. Or different "Fix Versions" in several duplicated issues would mismatch the road map.

2) Issues with Status = Closed and Resolution = Fixed
a) The "Fix Version" should be set with a specific release version otherwise no one knows in which release the issue was closed. Sometimes a "Fix Version" will never be set (e.g. using JIRA as a ticketing system), so this check should be optional.
b) Linked issues of type "incorporates" or "is part of" should have the same "Fix Version"s or at least one same "Fix Version". Otherwise why could this issue be fixed, while incorporated issues aren't fixed or not in the same release ("Fix Version").

3) Further ideas are welcome.


These checks maybe very project specific hence everybody has to decide to enable them or only enable some of the checks in his project.

The "Logical Issue Checker" should be a new "Permission Type", which is associated to the "JIRA Administrators" by default. I think the "Logical Issue Checker" is an enhanced filter functionality which is not covered by common filter in the "Find Issue" menu. The enhanced filter functionality should have the same benefits like the common filters, e.g. bulk edit. The functionality should be extendable by a new JiraService (e.g. LICService), so that any person can implement its own checks. Furthermore the project administrators can enable and disable the different check services, because not each service is relevant for a project.
fields.summary: Logical Issue Checker

fields.description: On "my personal desktop" I have a list of issues assigned to me. When I reload the dektop  (many times), issues with the same priority change order....

fields.description:
Hi
We have a export dump taken from HSQL
We are moving to oracle DB now.
When we tried to import it is not doing because certail comments/descriptiions have data beyond varchar2's capacity.
When we wnet through the forum of attalasian we came to know that we can identify those numbers and rectify. But the count is hugh and for certain cases we don't even appear in the list.
Is there a workaround for this??
fields.summary: Import fails -Data too large exception

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-3797].
  {panel}

JIRA is very usefull to build the Road Map based on user requirements. We can refine each requirement using comments.
The problem is that when the requirement has been understood and validated by everybody, anybody can continue to add comments. At the end, it can be difficult to know what will be developed exactly.

Consequently, it would be great to add a feature to freeze an issue and the associated Road Map. The following features should be added :
- Nobody can add a comment to a frozen issue 
- Nobody can change a field of a frozen issue
- An additional "Freeze Issue" permission should be added
- The "Freeze Issue" permission should allow to freeze or unfreeze issues
fields.summary: A Freeze Issue feature

fields.description:
The column should display the issue keys of subtasks.
The issue keys should be striked through if the issue has been closed (resolved)
The column should be sortable, such that issues with all resolved subtasks appear together (i.e. apart from an issue with at least some unresolved subtasks).

Note that the number of sub-tasks an issue has, does not matter for sorting. That is, if the issue has one sub-task unresolved it is treated the same as an issue which has 5 unresolved sub-tasks.

The issues with all unresolved sub-tasks will appear before issues with all resolved subtasks, followed by issues with no sub-tasks in Ascending (default) sort.
fields.summary: Create a sub-Task column that displays issue's sub-tasks (if any) in Issue Navigator
Document quick search

fields.description: Handle all the questions about '-Xmx128m not found', and the like.
fields.summary: Create 'troubleshooting JIRA installation' doc

fields.description: The user browser referred to here is the one that pops up when trying to specify a user/reporter in the issue navigator page.
fields.summary: Clicking the "Next" link in the "Specify a user popup" resets the filter

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-3791].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 19 March 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

In an effort to consolidate issues that accurately track our development priorities, I am going to close this issue. We do hope to address JIRA's notification system with more customizable notifications, but the improvements we are seeking to make are more accurately described in JRA-2565. We have no plans to introduce additional scripting capabilities.

As always, please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Thanks
Dave Meyer
Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}

the notification scheme stuff is very cool, but could be better.

on several occasions now, I've wanted something where a notification would be sent in certain situations, but I'm unable to express the situations using a scheme.  in particular, although I can trigger a notification on issue create, I can't say "trigger on issue create, if the issue is in component X, and was not created by user Y".

it's hard to see a simple way of enabling this from the GUI.

here's one possibility.  allow the list of notification triggers to be edited.  instead of having a single "issue created" trigger, with some number of notifications attached to it, allow any number of "issue created" triggers.  each trigger could have an optional attribute, which is  a boolean valued expression in some simple language.  the notifications for the trigger would fire if the expression evaluated to true in the context of the issue in question.

so, for example, you could have some number of primitive operators:

 component C  <-- true if the current issue is in component C
 reporter R <-- etc.
 beforetime T <-- true if the issue was created before time T
 
and some boolean connectives, and you're done.  when an issue is created, JIRA looks for all "issue created" triggers, executes their condition expressions in the context of the current issue, and fires the notifications if the condition is true.  or better, the "issue created" trigger type could just be incorportated into the expression.

there are probably other places in JIRA that could use this sort of thing.  listeners, for example, could be configured to fire only for a certain project.
fields.summary: notification scripting

fields.description:
In our example there is an entry with 20 min (estimated) and 18 min spent. The calculated difference is 6 hours resulting in 5 hours, 58 minutes of planned completion time.

example copied from the time tracking list:
NUC-21  	 	 	Entwickler Richtlinien anfangen  	20 minutes  	6 hours  	18 minutes  	5 hours, 58 minutes


This is not very useful when relying on this report.
fields.summary: Time tracking does not correctly calculate the difference

fields.description:
Would it be possible to have an issue finder "high scores" table or "leaderboard" portlet?

Essentially, we want beta testers of our software to have an incentive, eg. person who finds most issues wins a prize, etc.

Having a table that shows rankings based on how many issues have been reported by someone (excludes duplicates) either over a given time period or a specific version of the product would give an added incentive and hopefully make beta testing more like a competition. :)
fields.summary: Issue reporter "high scores" table?

fields.description:
When a mail is generated by the default notification scheme it sits on the mail queue and is not sent. Every time the application tries to send the mail the following exception is logged.

2004-05-19 13:03:30,966 ERROR [atlassian.jira.mail.IssueMailQueueItem] Could not find template 'templates\email\text/issuecreated.vm' ensure it is in the classpath.
org.apache.velocity.exception.VelocityException: Could not find template 'templates\email\text/issuecreated.vm' ensure it is in the classpath.
	at com.atlassian.velocity.DefaultVelocityManager.getEncodedBody(DefaultVelocityManager.java:88)
	at com.atlassian.jira.mail.MailingListCompiler.sendLists(MailingListCompiler.java:155)
	at com.atlassian.jira.mail.MailingListCompiler.sendLists(MailingListCompiler.java:106)
	at com.atlassian.jira.mail.IssueMailQueueItem.send(IssueMailQueueItem.java:107)
	at com.atlassian.mail.queue.MailQueueImpl.sendBuffer(MailQueueImpl.java:55)
	at com.atlassian.jira.service.services.mail.MailQueueService.run(MailQueueService.java:23)
	at com.atlassian.jira.service.JiraServiceContainer.run(JiraServiceContainer.java:51)
	at com.atlassian.jira.service.ServiceRunner.execute(ServiceRunner.java:50)
	at org.quartz.core.JobRunShell.run(JobRunShell.java:147)
	at org.quartz.simpl.SimpleThreadPool$WorkerThread.run(SimpleThreadPool.java:387)
2004-05-19 13:03:30,966 ERROR [atlassian.mail.queue.MailQueueImpl] com.atlassian.mail.MailException: Could not find template 'templates\email\text/issuecreated.vm' ensure it is in the classpath.

I have checked in the war file and the files are there
fields.summary: Mail sits in mail queue and not sent

fields.description:
Reproduction as follows:

1) Open two windows with Jira
2) In both windows open project road maps of different projects
3) Click All versions in both windows

Both windows now show project info of the project where you clicked "All versions" the first. The project ID is pulled from the users' session, not the URL clicked which doesn't contain the project id.
fields.summary: Roadmap scope url doesn't contain project ID
Ability to resend notification emails

fields.description:
Currently you can only link an issue one at a time.  If you are selecting a large number of links, then this is cumbersome.

We should allow the selection of more issues to link to, perhaps comma separated.

Sort user list

fields.description: Improve Component Management - introduce component icon.
fields.summary: Improve Component Management - introduce component icon

fields.description:
Currently, the bugzilla import process allocates new issue IDs for each bug.  The original bugzilla ID seems to be buried in some kind of custom field in the imported issue.

It would be great to have the option to use bugzilla's ID instead, e.g. Bug 123 would be imported as issue XYZ-123. 

This would make it much easier to move users across to JIRA, since our users make heavy use of bug IDs.
fields.summary: Convert bugzilla text links to JIRA links during import

fields.description:
We should exclude the encoding filter from setting the encoding on attachments.  Not really sure what will happen - perhaps uses the browser's default setting?

We've had one customer request this - so I think that it is probably best to not set it.
fields.summary: Encoding filter sets encoding for html attachments

fields.description:
The Bugzilla portlet is useful for JIRA installations whose original data came from Bugzilla, and whose users want to search for an issue by its old Bugzilla ID.  They can enter the ID into the portlet text field, and will be taken to the JIRA issue.  If no JIRA issue is found, they are redirected to the Bugzilla issue (eg. the bug was in a project that wasn't imported).

The bugzilla portlet is visible at http://issues.apache.org/jira/
fields.summary: Add Bugzilla portlet

fields.description:
I get the following error after running Jira for a couple of days.

273099086 [WorkerThread-2] ERROR queue.MailQueueImpl  - com.atlassian.mail.MailException: smtp

I'm not sure what else to debug.  I usually have to restart the entire application server.
fields.summary: MailException after a few days of running

fields.description: JIRA system allows creation of two custom fields having the same name and same scope. This should not happen, since it creates confusion.
fields.summary: Dupplicate custom fields

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-3774].
  {panel}

The Users cannot be deleted as they are either raised issues or being assigned.  I would suggest to have a option of disabling the user so that he cannot access the project.

I know there is a work around here by removing the user groups assigned to the user.  But it would again take time to reassign the required groups.  just by disabling the user i can avoid some time spend on reassigning.  This will be further difficult if the user is assigned to too many projects at different levels.

Also i would like you to ask is there any work around for deleting the user permanently having the issues assigned to him earlier.  Which should not change.

Vivek
fields.summary: User Management: Disable user accounts

fields.description:
Whenever I try to see the Full Content view on the issue navigator, I get the following exception. It seems to occur on every filter I've tried. Tomcat's catalina.out log shows nothing. Apache Tomcat/4.0.3 - Error report

Apache Tomcat/4.0.3 - HTTP Status 500 - Internal Server Error

type Exception report

message Internal Server Error

description The server encountered an internal error (Internal Server Error) that prevented it from fulfilling this request.

exception 

java.lang.NullPointerException
	at java.util.Hashtable.put(Hashtable.java:393)
	at org.apache.jasper.runtime.PageContextImpl.setAttribute(PageContextImpl.java:229)
	at webwork.view.taglib.BeanTag.doStartTag(BeanTag.java:79)
	at org.apache.jsp.navigator_0002dfull$jsp._jspService(navigator_0002dfull$jsp.java:1358)
	at org.apache.jasper.runtime.HttpJspBase.service(HttpJspBase.java:107)
	at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:853)
	at org.apache.jasper.servlet.JspServlet$JspServletWrapper.service(JspServlet.java:202)
	at org.apache.jasper.servlet.JspServlet.serviceJspFile(JspServlet.java:382)
	at org.apache.jasper.servlet.JspServlet.service(JspServlet.java:474)
	at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:853)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationDispatcher.invoke(ApplicationDispatcher.java:683)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationDispatcher.doForward(ApplicationDispatcher.java:431)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationDispatcher.forward(ApplicationDispatcher.java:355)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.dispatcher.JiraServletDispatcher.service(JiraServletDispatcher.java:260)

fields.summary: NPE on Full Content view

fields.description:
License: NiLOSTEP Information Sciences
Release 2.6.1 - #65

DESCRIPTION

When I installed Jira I created an admin account 'Beheerder'. Note the first uppercase character. I was not warned that JIRA usernames are lowercase. I did not know that as I am a first time user.

I could not log in after the installation... I tried this two, three times. By accident I forgot the uppercase and... it worked. Then I noticed during the creation of the other users that usernames are lowercase only.

HOW TO REPRODUCE

Fresh-install 2.6.1-#65 stand-alone PRO and enter for the initial admin account: Beheerder.
Complete the install and try to login...
fields.summary: use of uppercase in admin username during install causes problem

fields.description: Issues when selected for "Full Content" View does not show the actual date of history it shows the date of creation for all the Issue history items.
fields.summary: Issues when view in "Full Content" View does not give actual dates of Modification

fields.description: The current basic clone issue functionality does not clone custom fields if present in an issue.
fields.summary: Clone issue should also include custom field data when cloning an issue

fields.description:
Currently security levels are listed in creation order.

It would be better if they would be listed in alphabetical order, or if the order was configurable like in all the other schemes.

Now it is hard to find the correct security level, if there are multiple levels in one security scheme. This creates a security problem, since issues may be placed in incorrect security levels by mistake.
fields.summary: Security levels should be sorted alphabetically or be orderable

fields.description:
We should store the entire email in the database, instead of just storing the body.

Then we can do funky things such as displaying the emails with nice headers.
fields.summary: Store entire emails instead of just the body
All Developers RoadMap within version showing workload summary

fields.description: Subtasks cannot be cloned. There may be cases where users wish to clone a subtask within the same issue.
fields.summary: Subtasks cannot be cloned.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-3765].
  {panel}

Idea:

To be able to report on a user's (or my own) change history.

Very similar to the "change history" for an issue.  Except that instead of reporting by issue, report by user over time.

To generate the report, first a start date and an end date would be chosen, then a user.

My motivation for this is so I can easily see what I've done over the last 2 weeks when filling in my timesheets (in a seperate green screen app).
fields.summary: Work History - on user (complementing  Issue History)

fields.description:
When attaching multiple files, if an error occurs, all selections are lost - even if they are valid file attachments.

For example, select a valid attachment file and a file that is 0K in size or is too large ( > 5M). Both selections are lost when the error message is displayed.
fields.summary: Multiple Attachments - if error occurs, all selections are lost.

fields.description:
If attempting to attach a single file and an error occurs (e.g. the file is too large or does not exist) - the attachment display switches to the multiple option.

The display should remain with the single view while showing the error message.
fields.summary: Attachment display changes if error occurs in attaching file.
Assignment when creating a bug with multiple components
